title: Covid: Ivermectin, milk among Indonesia's unproven cures
description: As Indonesia sees a surge fueled by the Delta variant, misleading health claims are spreading.

title: The little tech firm gunning for an airspeed record
description: Electroflight has built the E-NXT which it hopes will break the electric airspeed record.

title: Covid: Will lockdown change England's new tech habits?
description: The pandemic brought about big changes in the way people use tech - the question is will they last?

title: Tokyo Olympics: Athletes find new ways to train in lockdown
description: Participants in the upcoming Games have been going to unusual lengths to stay in shape under restrictions.

title: First space tourist Dennis Tito: 'I was euphoric'
description: Dennis Tito paid $20 million to travel to the International Space Station in 2001.

title: Can seaside town Scarborough's post-lockdown boom last?
description: The BBC's David Sillito visits his hometown of Scarborough, which is seeing a post-lockdown boom.

title: Tokyo Olympics: Tom Daley on triumph, trauma and his likely last shot at gold
description: The 'baby' of Beijing has become a father, a husband and an LGBTQ+ spokesperson. Tom Daley has perhaps one final shot at Olympic gold.

title: Covid: Can children have the Covid vaccine in the UK?
description: Hundreds of thousands of under-18s will now be offered the jab in the UK - but not all. Here's why.

title: A weekend in America: Shootings in Washington spotlight growing problem
description: A stadium was sent into panic and a six-year-old was killed in two of the weekend's worst shootings.

title: Dan Biggar: Grieving British and Irish Lions fly-half eyes Test start in South Africa
description: Dan Biggar targets an "emotional" first British and Irish Lions Test start against South Africa after the recent death of his mother.

title: Covid: Vaccine passport plan for nightclubs 'concerning'
description: Manchester's night-time economy advisor brands the government's certification plan "discriminatory".

title: Covid is 'just the worst experience'
description: As most coronavrirus restrictions in England are lifted, Covid patients urge the public to take care.

title: Covid: What is the pilot testing scheme to avoid self-isolation?
description: The prime minister and chancellor were to participate in a trial to avoid self-isolation but then backtracked.

title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

title: Tokyo 2020: Top 10 days for Team GB at the Olympics
description: BBC Sport selects the top 10 unmissable days for Team GB fans at the Tokyo 2020 Olympics.

title: Carlos Ghosn: Father and son sentenced for helping ex-Nissan boss escape
description: Michael and Peter Taylor were convicted of helping ex-Nissan boss Carlos Ghosn escape Japan in 2019.

title: The Papers: 'Freedom day farce' and PM's isolation 'flip flopping'
description: Monday's papers are dominated by the news the PM and chancellor are self-isolating ahead of the lifting of Covid rules in England.

title: Nightclubs reopening: The problems the industry faces because of Covid
description: Figures given to Radio 1 Newsbeat show a quarter of clubs have closed in the past six years.

title: Johnson urges caution as Covid rules ease in England
description: There will be no limit on how many people can meet, nightclubs can reopen and large events resume.

title: Katie Hopkins to be deported from Australia over quarantine rules
description: Katie Hopkins - a right-wing British commentator - bragged about plans to break isolation rules.

title: Covid: Double-jabbed NHS staff could avoid isolation if service under pressure
description: Fully-vaccinated health workers in England could skip quarantine if services come under pressure.
